pull.title: build: ignore macOS make deploy artefacts & add them to clean-local

events.body:
Concept ACK, the file is produced in the makefile (though, not by any umbrella rule), so it should be ignored

also code review ACK 290c5c6ae80668a1e8090be74f653b0f24704d97

rename.from: trivial: build: ignore osx_volname & add it to clean-local
rename.to: build: ignore osx_volname & add it to clean-local

rename.from: build: ignore osx_volname & add it to clean-local
rename.to: build: ignore macOS make deploy artefacts & add them to clean-local

events.body: @hebasto The artefacts occur when building for a macOS HOST on a Linux machine.

Tested master branch on Linux Mint 19.2:
```
cd depends
make HOST=x86_64-apple-darwin14 SDK_PATH=`pwd`/SDKs
cd ..
./configure --prefix=`pwd`/depends/x86_64-apple-darwin14
make deploy
```

Artefacts:
- `dist/` folder -- observed
- `dpi36.background.tiff` -- observed
- `dpi72.background.tiff` -- observed
- `osx_volname` -- _not_ observed

events.message: build: ignore macOS make deploy artefacts & add them to clean-local

events.body:
ACK c84ff23c6daade5145d960e1ac26596ddede2da1, tested on Linux Mint 19.2:
- `make` with targets `osx_volname`, `deploydir` and `deploy` creates the mentioned artefacts
- `make clean` removes them
